title: Embedding Protocol for TEM
author: Opentrons
description: With this protocol, your robot can work with the mPrep/s™ capsules. Instead of picking up regular pipette tips, user will manually attach the tips to the P300 multi-channel pipette. The robot will deliver the reagents to the capsules through using a series of mixing commands.
process:
Download your protocol.
Upload your protocol into the OT App.
Set up your deck according to the deck map.
Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our support article.
Hit "Run".
The pipette will move to the front of the robot for user to attach the specimen.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Fix Rince 1.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Fix Rince 2.
Robot will mix 600 x with Osmium 1%.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Os Rince 1.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Os Rince 2.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 30% EtOH.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 50% EtOH.
Robot will mix 600 x iwith  Uranyl Acetate.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 70% EtOH.
Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 90% EtOH.
Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% EtOH 1.
Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% EtOH 2.
Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% Aceton 1.
Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% Aceton 2.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 25% Durcupan in Aceton.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 50% Durcupan in Aceton.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 75% Durcupan in Aceton.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 1.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 2.
Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 3.
Pipette 100µl 100% Durcupan 4.
Pipette will move to the front for user to detach the specimen.
notes: Make sure to calibrate the labware using the mPrep/s™ capsules instead of regular pipette tips.

markdown.title: Embedding Protocol for TEM
markdown.author: [Opentrons](http://www.opentrons.com/)
markdown.description: With this protocol, your robot can work with the [mPrep/s™ capsules](https://microscopyinnovations.com/mpreps-2/). Instead of picking up regular pipette tips, user will manually attach the tips to the P300 multi-channel pipette. The robot will deliver the reagents to the capsules through using a series of mixing commands.
markdown.process:
1. Download your protocol.
2. Upload your protocol into the [OT App](https://opentrons.com/ot-app).
3. Set up your deck according to the deck map.
4. Calibrate your labware, tiprack and pipette using the OT App. For calibration tips, check out our [support article](https://support.opentrons.com/ot-2/getting-started-software-setup/deck-calibration).
5. Hit "Run".
6. The pipette will move to the front of the robot for user to attach the specimen.
7. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Fix Rince 1.
8. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Fix Rince 2.
9. Robot will mix 600 x with Osmium 1%.
10. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Os Rince 1.
11. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl Os Rince 2.
12. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 30% EtOH.
13. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 50% EtOH.
14. Robot will mix 600 x iwith  Uranyl Acetate.
15. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 70% EtOH.
16. Robot will mix 60 x with 100µl 90% EtOH.
17. Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% EtOH 1.
18. Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% EtOH 2.
19. Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% Aceton 1.
20. Robot will mix 240 x with 100µl 100% Aceton 2.
21. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 25% Durcupan in Aceton.
22. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 50% Durcupan in Aceton.
23. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 75% Durcupan in Aceton.
24. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 1.
25. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 2.
26. Robot will mix 600 x with 100µl 100% Durcupan 3.
27. Pipette 100µl 100% Durcupan 4.
28. Pipette will move to the front for user to detach the specimen.
markdown.notes: * Make sure to calibrate the labware using the mPrep/s™ capsules instead of regular pipette tips.
